subj:16000000.name: unrest, conflicts and war
subj:16000000.description: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence.

subj:16001000.name: act of terror
subj:16001000.description: Act of violence, often deadly, designed to raise fear and anxiety in a population

subj:16002000.name: armed conflict
subj:16002000.description: Disputes between opposing groups involving the use of weaponry, but not formally declared a war

subj:16003000.name: civil unrest
subj:16003000.description: Dissatisfaction among the general population as evidenced by rallies, strikes, demonstrations or sabotage

subj:16003001.name: revolutions
subj:16003001.description: An often violent change in a nation's system of government by internal forces that results in systematic social change.

subj:16003002.name: rebellions
subj:16003002.description: Armed uprising by citizens of a nation with the intent to overthrow the government, without necessarily achieving social change

subj:16003003.name: political dissent
subj:16003003.description: Disagreement between political groups, usually organized and sometimes resulting in imprisonment of the dissenters

subj:16004000.name: coup d'etat
subj:16004000.description: The overthrow of an established government by an organized group, often the military or a political party

subj:16005000.name: guerrilla activity
subj:16005000.description: Anti-government actions by clandestine groups using hit-and-run techniques or sabotage, kidnapping and the like

subj:16005001.name: bioterrorism
subj:16005001.description: Use of biological agent to raise the level of fear within a population, whether deaths occur or not.

subj:16005002.name: bombings
subj:16005002.description: Use of explosive devices against people, buildings or structures

subj:16006000.name: massacre
subj:16006000.description: The death of a large group of people over a brief period of time

subj:16006001.name: genocide
subj:16006001.description: Systematic killing of one clan, tribe or ethnic type by another

subj:16007000.name: riots
subj:16007000.description: Violent, destructive demonstrations often involving injury to individuals and destruction of property

subj:16008000.name: demonstration
subj:16008000.description: A public show of feeling or opinion, as by a mass meeting or parade

subj:16009000.name: war
subj:16009000.description: A formal declaration of hostilities by one country against another

subj:16009001.name: civil war
subj:16009001.description: Armed conflict between members of the same nation or geographical region, in some cases with a desire to divide the nation or region.

subj:16009002.name: international military intervention
subj:16009002.description: Temporary use of international forces by invitation or by a decision of an outside body in another country or region for the purpose of resolving a crisis.

subj:16009003.name: prisoners and detainees
subj:16009003.description: People captured and imprisoned by their enemy during war or armed conflict

subj:16010000.name: conflict (general)
subj:16010000.description: A dispute which can be at several levels,

subj:16010001.name: peacekeeping force
subj:16010001.description: Varied national military forces under unified international command to maintain order in disputed areas.

subj:16011000.name: crisis
subj:16011000.description: Conflict of all kinds that rises to a level where, depending on events, governments can fall, war be declared or stock markets crash, or not

subj:16012000.name: weaponry
subj:16012000.description: Armaments of all types used to conduct war

subj:11000000.name: politics
subj:11000000.description: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

subj:11001000.name: defence
subj:11001000.description: Anything involving the defence of one's own country

subj:11001001.name: veterans affairs
subj:11001001.description: Care and provision for those who served in the military

subj:11001002.name: national security
subj:11001002.description: The philosophy of securing a nation and its borders, as well as the well being of its citizens

subj:11001003.name: security measures
subj:11001003.description: Means of making a nation, a state, a building or a person secure from harm and outside interference.

subj:11001004.name: armed Forces
subj:11001004.description: Those employed by a government to conduct war, or to enforce the security of a nation

subj:11001005.name: military equipment
subj:11001005.description: Equipment issued to members of the armed forces

subj:11001006.name: firearms
subj:11001006.description: Anything that uses an explosive in a directed manner to propel an object that can maim or kill

subj:11001007.name: biological and chemical weapons
subj:11001007.description: Devices using biological agents, or chemical mixtures to disable, maim or kill an opponent

subj:11001008.name: missile systems
subj:11001008.description: Anything that propels an inert, explosive, biological or chemical object through the air with the aim of disabling, maiming or killing an opponent.

subj:11001009.name: nuclear weapons
subj:11001009.description: Weapons that use controlled radioactivity from the decay of certain elements to disable, maim or kill an opponent

subj:11002000.name: diplomacy
subj:11002000.description: The use of verbal and written skills for persuading others to your point of view

subj:11002001.name: summit
subj:11002001.description: Includes meetings of leaders, foreign and finance ministers from the Group of Eight major nations and Group of Seven industrialized nations.

subj:11002002.name: international relations
subj:11002002.description: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

subj:11002003.name: peace negotiations
subj:11002003.description: Negotiations intended to bring an end to a conflict

subj:11002004.name: alliances
subj:11002004.description: Coalitions of like-minded groups formed to present a stronger force against any challenges

subj:11003000.name: election
subj:11003000.description: The selection of representatives by the casting of votes

subj:11003001.name: political candidates
subj:11003001.description: Individuals who are chosen to stand for office

subj:11003003.name: campaign finance
subj:11003003.description: The money that makes campaigns for public office possible

subj:11003004.name: national elections
subj:11003004.description: Choosing individuals for government at a national level

subj:11003005.name: regional elections
subj:11003005.description: Choosing individuals for government at a regional level

subj:11003006.name: local elections
subj:11003006.description: Choosing individuals for government at the basic level, whether city, village or county

subj:11003007.name: voting
subj:11003007.description: The act of selecting an individual you would like to represent your interests in government

subj:11003008.name: poll
subj:11003008.description: Periodic measurement of a political candidate's standing with the public

subj:11003009.name: european elections
subj:11003009.description: Choosing individuals for a body which is at a higher level than national government, e.g. European parliament

subj:11003010.name: primary
subj:11003010.description: Preliminary elections on a local or regional basis leading up to a regional or national election

subj:11005000.name: foreign aid
subj:11005000.description: Help provided by one nation to another

subj:11005001.name: economic sanction
subj:11005001.description: Punitive actions taken by one country against another including trade restrictions, embargoes etc.

subj:11006000.name: government
subj:11006000.description: The system for ruling a country

subj:11006001.name: civil and public service
subj:11006001.description: The paid service by civilians for the government, and the often non-paid service of individuals for the benefit of others (public service)

subj:11006002.name: safety of citizens
subj:11006002.description: Government policies to protect the well being of its citizens

subj:11006003.name: think tank
subj:11006003.description: Group that undertakes political research and issue position papers, recommendations etc

subj:11006004.name: national government
subj:11006004.description: The ruling body of a nation

subj:11006005.name: executive (government)
subj:11006005.description: That portion of a ruling body involving the overall operation of government

subj:11006006.name: heads of state
subj:11006006.description: Symbolic or actual chief representative of a nation, such as royalty, or president or emir, for example

subj:11006007.name: government departments
subj:11006007.description: Divisions of a government that concentrate on specific areas such as health, welfare, economy or war

subj:11006008.name: public officials
subj:11006008.description: Individuals, usually elected, who are in public service or commonly in the public eye.

subj:11006009.name: ministers (government)
subj:11006009.description: Heads of various government departments at one level, also known as secretaries. At another level they form a legislative body. The chief minister is either prime minister or premier.

subj:11006010.name: public employees
subj:11006010.description: People employed by a government at all levels

subj:11006011.name: privatisation
subj:11006011.description: The privatisation of state-owned companies or property

subj:11006012.name: nationalisation
subj:11006012.description: State takeover of private companies or property

subj:11006013.name: impeachment
subj:11006013.description: The process of bringing a public official before a tribunal to answer charges of wrongdoing

subj:11007000.name: human rights
subj:11007000.description: Rights entitled to be enjoyed by all citizens universally

subj:11008000.name: local authority
subj:11008000.description: Authorities at city, county state or borough level

subj:11009000.name: parliament
subj:11009000.description: The collective body of elected officials representing the people

subj:11009001.name: upper house
subj:11009001.description: Senior chamber of a legislative body

subj:11009002.name: lower house
subj:11009002.description: The lower chamber of a legislative body

subj:11010000.name: parties and movements
subj:11010000.description: Covers both formally recognized and informal political associations

subj:11010001.name: non government organizations (NGO)
subj:11010001.description: Groups officially outside of government that lobby, demonstrate or campaign on a wide range of issues such as economics, environment healthcare etc.

subj:11011000.name: refugee
subj:11011000.description: A person seeking shelter in another country because of some fear of persecution in his own country

subj:11012000.name: regional authority
subj:11012000.description: Government bodies at levels encompassing more than one jurisdiction, e.g. the Delaware River Basin Commission

subj:11013000.name: state budget and tax
subj:11013000.description: The national budget as promulgated by the government

subj:11013001.name: public finance
subj:11013001.description: The money of government used for paying for public programs and services and public debt

subj:11015000.name: constitution
subj:11015000.description: Usually a written document setting forth the operations of a government and the rights of the citizens therein

subj:11016000.name: interior policy
subj:11016000.description: Government policies affecting internal affairs of a country

subj:11016001.name: data protection
subj:11016001.description: Efforts to protect personal information in either written, oral or electronic form

subj:11016002.name: housing and urban planning
subj:11016002.description: Systematic planning of urban and suburban areas and the housing within those areas

subj:11016003.name: pension and welfare
subj:11016003.description: Government policies affecting the well being of its citizens through unemployment benefits, state pensions and other similar payments

subj:11016004.name: personal weapon control
subj:11016004.description: Government control of personal ownership of firearms and other offensive weapons, including control of weapons used for sports through licenses and other means

subj:11016006.name: personal data collection
subj:11016006.description: The collection, by government or other entities of information on individuals

subj:11016007.name: planning inquiries
subj:11016007.description: Public hearings or planning inquiries on proposed constructions, e.g. Construction of water driven power station in a National Park.

subj:11017000.name: migration
subj:11017000.description: Movement of one body of persons from one place to another

subj:11018000.name: citizens initiative and recall
subj:11018000.description: Political suggestions by non-government officials for corrective action, or for changes in existing rules and regulations

subj:11019000.name: referenda
subj:11019000.description: Political proposals, laws and actions suggested by non-government officials to be voted on by the entire voting body

subj:11020000.name: nuclear policy
subj:11020000.description: Government policies as regards to use of nuclear fuels for power production or weapons

subj:11021000.name: lobbying
subj:11021000.description: The attempt by non-government bodies and individual to affect the outcome of legislation through verbal, or other, persuasion

subj:11022000.name: regulatory policy and organisation
subj:11022000.description: The rules and bodies, both national and international, that govern conflict of interest and good practice regulations.

subj:11023000.name: censorship
subj:11023000.description: Attempts by any group to control freedoms of speech, religion, and ideas distributed in print, graphics, cyberspace and other ways. Does not include official standards such as cinema ratings, advertising and broadcast standards.

subj:11024000.name: politics (general)
subj:11024000.description: The art or science of participating in the affairs of government, a state of political party

subj:11024001.name: political systems
subj:11024001.description: Systems designed to provide order to government

subj:11024002.name: democracy
subj:11024002.description: Government in which the people hold the power either directly, or through elected officials.

subj:11024003.name: political development
subj:11024003.description: The creation and rise of political systems and the history of the people and nations that are associated with those systems.

subj:11025000.name: freedom of the press
subj:11025000.description: Mass media rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the journalists, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to press freedom

subj:11026000.name: freedom of religion
subj:11026000.description: Religious rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the believers, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to freedom of belief and practice

subj:11027000.name: treaty
subj:11027000.description: A treaty (as defined by the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties) is a written agreement between international entities that is binding under international law.

subj:11028000.name: international organisation
subj:11028000.description: Includes organisations with members and functions that cross international borders, and may include intergovernmental organisations of sovereign nations.
